p: The physical and chemical properties analysis of CSO are presented in Table 1. The oil content of chia seed ranged from 31.39 to 32.39 g/100 g, much higher than that in soybean (17.6 to 25.4 g/100 g) reported by Dornbos et al. [ 10]. The result was consistent with the published data (31.2 g/100 g, on average, of Brazil chia seed) [ 11] and 28.5â€“32.70 g/100 g in chia seeds from Colombia, Argentina, Peru and Bolivia [ 12]. The results obtained in this study suggested that chia seed was a good source of crude oil based on the high yield of oil content.
